I choose to kill Player 3. I aim to follow the strategy of creating confusion and preserving deception. Player 3 is in the middle of the player list, which is often overlooked as players tend to suspect either the first couple of players or the last ones to act. By avoiding killing the first or the last players, I'm hoping to evade immediate patterns which could be noticed. Since all players from 2 to 5 are unknown, choosing among them is arbitrary; hence, my decision is to target Player 3.

Player 3 targets me without proof. Evidence must guide accusations; observe player 3's future actions closely.
